1. Warner Bros. Video Games Business 'Relatively Minor Compared to the Grand Scheme of Things,' Netflix Says  IGN
  2. Netflix didn’t attribute any value to Warner Bros. Games business in $83bn mega deal  PocketGamer.biz
  3. 'We actually didn't attribute any value' to Warner's game studios, Netflix boss says about the acquisition deal: 'They're relatively minor compared to the grand scheme of things'  PC Gamer
  4. What does the Netflix deal mean for Warner Bros's games division?  GamesIndustry.biz
  5. Netflix Hints ‘Hogwarts Legacy 2’ Could Survive Its WB Deal, But What Else?  Forbes

item.title: Call Of Duty Will No Longer Release Back-To-Back Modern Warfare Or Black Ops Games - Game Informer
item.description:
1. Call Of Duty Will No Longer Release Back-To-Back Modern Warfare Or Black Ops Games  Game Informer
  2. Black Ops 7: Update  Call of Duty
  3. Activision knows the real problem with Call of Duty is its relentless 12-month cycle, but it simply won't end unless you stop playing  PC Gamer
  4. Call of Duty won’t release Modern Warfare or Black Ops back-to-back anymore  The Verge
  5. Activision to change release strategy for Call of Duty, as new data suggests player count has halved in 12 months  GamesIndustry.biz
